p: The MAPKs (mitogen activated protein kinases) mediate several cellular activities involved in the cancer progression such as evading apoptosis, inducing proliferation and immune escape ( Cargnello and Roux, 2011; Peluso et al., 2019). MAPK family includes following members: c-Jun N terminal kinase (JNK), ERK (extracellular signal-regulated kinase) and the p38 MAPK ( Soares-Silva et al., 2016). Phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase (PI3K)/Akt is one of the most important intracellular pathway that perform several important roles in proliferation, cell growth and survival which makes it an attractive target for cancer therapy ( Yang et al., 2019).
